Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Based on Stone's own experiences as a soldier in the conflict, "Platoon" captivated millions of viewers all over the world. But how much of the film was real and how much was Hollywood fiction? To reveal the real story, we recreate scenes; uncover a radio transmission from the battle that inspired the movie's climax, and interview writer/director Oliver Stone and cast member Willem Dafoe.

Clip.Title: 40 UNDER 40
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Go behind the scenes of the "40 under 40: Craft Futures" exhibition, featuring traditional and non-traditional works of decorative art created by the top 40 American craft artists under the age of 40.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: At the Smithsonian, science and history - and even art and design - are used to help predict the future. Join host Tom Cavanagh as we look at designers who have shaped our future, sneak a peek at museum of the future, and talk to scientists helping to preserve the future of the tropical rainforest.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Little parts of our world disappear every day. Join host, Tom Cavanagh as learns what Smithsonian experts are doing to protect the best aspects of our world for future generations using "extreme conservation."

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Based on Stone's own experiences as a soldier in the conflict, "Platoon" captivated millions of viewers all over the world. But how much of the film was real and how much was Hollywood fiction? To reveal the real story, we recreate scenes; uncover a radio transmission from the battle that inspired the movie's climax, and interview writer/director Oliver Stone and cast member Willem Dafoe.

Clip.Title: 40 UNDER 40
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Go behind the scenes of the "40 under 40: Craft Futures" exhibition, featuring traditional and non-traditional works of decorative art created by the top 40 American craft artists under the age of 40.

Clip.Title: AERIAL FRANCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get an up close look at the beautiful French landscape from above and a taste of the rich culture on the stunning coasts.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the remote Northern Shore of Nova Scotia, to the red mud perimetre of Prince Edward Island, the warm waters of the Northumberland Strait are the setting for an incredible aerial exploration of these coastlines.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Based on Stone's own experiences as a soldier in the conflict, "Platoon" captivated millions of viewers all over the world. But how much of the film was real and how much was Hollywood fiction? To reveal the real story, we recreate scenes; uncover a radio transmission from the battle that inspired the movie's climax, and interview writer/director Oliver Stone and cast member Willem Dafoe.

Clip.Title: 40 UNDER 40
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Go behind the scenes of the "40 under 40: Craft Futures" exhibition, featuring traditional and non-traditional works of decorative art created by the top 40 American craft artists under the age of 40.

Clip.Title: THE KGB DISSIDENT
Clip.EpisodeSummary: This documentary tells the story of KGB officer Viktor Orekhov who monitored, collected evidence and severely punished the dissidents of the USSR.

Clip.Title: OPERATION MINCEMEAT
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Based on the best-selling book, Operation Mincemeat reveals the most successful deception of World War II that has been shrouded in secrecy for more than sixty years.

Clip.Title: MISSION TO MURDER HITLER
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The operation Valkyrie to kill Hitler was led by German resistance willing to turn traitor to save lives. See how the plot was nearly carried out, through gripping re-enactments, and firsthand interviews from members of the resistance.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Greek Beekeepers and Villagers are ravaged by wildfires, fueled by the arid atmosphere and abetted by the change in climate.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The high-altitude Glaciers that dot this nation are beginning to recede, and the local people are the first to suffer.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Veterinary surgeon must fix cross border collie Sasha's blown disk with a specially designed bolt to insert into her spine, and he must save a cat maimed by a car.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: At the edge of Western Australia's dry and desolate desert lies a marine reserve known as Ningaloo Reef. Ningaloo is one of the world's largest fringing reefs, and it stretches north to south for over 180 miles. And even though It's only 2% the size of the Great Barrier Reef, it rivals it in diversity.

Clip.Title: NAMIBIA'S WILD WONDERS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In the untamed and uncompromising wilds of southwestern Africa, a remarkable and resourceful array of life exists. Here, animals, insects, birds, plants, and reptiles not only survive but thrive in one of our planet's toughest environments. How do they do it?

Clip.Title: AMAZON RIVER CROCS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Cameramen and biologists travel to the heart of Guyana to find and study one of the biggest living reptiles and predators on earth- the black caiman.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Veterinary surgeon must fix cross border collie Sasha's blown disk with a specially designed bolt to insert into her spine, and he must save a cat maimed by a car.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: At the edge of Western Australia's dry and desolate desert lies a marine reserve known as Ningaloo Reef. Ningaloo is one of the world's largest fringing reefs, and it stretches north to south for over 180 miles. And even though It's only 2% the size of the Great Barrier Reef, it rivals it in diversity.
